metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7855 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player before 23.0.0.205 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.643 on Linux allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, as exploited in the wild in October 2016.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.643ubuntu0.16.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.643ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.643ubuntu0.16.04.1').
